Mr. Green came to his son's bed and sat down beside him. Looking at that little sad face, he asked, "Tom, what kind of _ did you have?"
"It was a _ day for me, Daddy." Tom answered. "I had a fight( ) with David. We made our teacher angry. She sent a note home about me. And I talked back to mom. She is _ , too. I am so sorry, Daddy."
"I know. So part of the day was bad," said Mr. Green. " _ tell me about the best thing today."
Jack thought for a while and _ . "After school I went fishing myself," he said. "I didn't think I would have any _ . But I did. I caught a fish!"
"I'm glad you had a good time," said Mr. Green. "Try to think about it until  you go to sleep. Now I'm going to turn off the light. I hope I will see a happy boy tomorrow. Good night!"
Every night, Tom answers the _ question. "What was the best thing that happened to you today?" Every night, Tom thinks about the best thing. Of course it is very helpful for him to have a good sleep.
Sometimes he has to think _ to find the best thing. Sometimes it is a very small thing. But he always finds one good thing to think about. This is a good way Tom's father taught him to _ his day.
